Posts.Content: It seems we all behave the same. I think waiting for the test results was worse than being told I had breast cancer and had to have chemo. I couldn't breathe I was panicking so much. My GP gave me some mild sleeping pills which really really helped and guess what as soon as I got my results I slept like a baby and didn't need them. I agree with mags panic attacks are about feeling loss of control. There's loads of help tho to get through this stage. My GP was great xxx
Posts.Title: panic attacks

Posts.Content: Just so you know I found 15 strength manuka honey in sainsburys. It was fifteen quid but I think it's worth it if u can avoid mouth ulcers and boost your immune system.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in 11 days.....

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, just wanted to say I did not have manuka honey during the first chemo and ended up with mouth ulcers which stopped me from talking but worse still it hurt to swallow (even rice pudding). Started taking 1 spoonful of manuka a day (15 strength) and since then touch wood I've had nothing. I can't say it helped my constipation which I've had for a couple of days after each chemo. I took 2 senokots each night for 2 nights and ate loads of fruit and that really helped compared to the pain from the first chemo. It really is a learning curve isn't it. I would say however, the best thing I've done so far is step up my water intake. Everyday I make sure I drink over a litre above my usual intake of tea coffee water etc etc and I have to say I have noticed a massive improvement to my life. For example I am not so tired ie hangover tired, and I feel healthier and more energetic.... Slow for cancer but energetic in comparison. I have also learnt to listen to my body. I stupidly Thought I could do it all.... Oh no... Don't risk your blood count girlies..... If your body tells you to rest.... Bloody we'll sit down, drink water and rest.... Don't fight it. It isn't worth losing a week. These are my best tips. Hair loss.... Yes awful, I'm bald but now I here in such great company I have to say that it wasn't as bad as I thought. In honesty I was more peed off about the mouth ulcer (I was very hungry)!!!!! Hair loss proves chemo is working and it will grow back we should all be celebrating xxx
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in 11 days.....

Posts.Content: Hi I have had 2 chemos so far and so far so good, only one bad day where I managed to lose my hair get a mouth ulcer and end up with a sore backside thanks to constipation. But it all went away thanks to magic remedying from the breast cancer nurses. I've not been sick and my wig is great. I have simply had to change things around. So if I'm a bit tired, I sit and do my nails. The best advice I could possibly give you is to drink drink loads of water, take water with u to chemo and start drinking as soon as they put it in and carry on. I truly believe this has helped me with any potential side effects. You don't need to keep the stuff in it only needs to bleach you then it can go so flush it out asap. All the very very best. Let us know how you get on. There's loads of help and advice here xxx
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in 11 days.....

Posts.Content: Congratulations. I can't wait to be at your stage I'm currently in bed thanks to bloody tax. It's lovely to know there is a light at the end of the tunnel x
Posts.Title: 10k Great Scottish Run

Posts.Content: Yes we have the same. My mums sister had breast cancer passed away aged 46 my dad's sister had bone cancer passed away late forties, my grandad pancreatic, my cousin in remission breast cancer in forties, my sister palliative breast cancer mid forties and me curable breast cancer in forties. So I would suggest that our cancer is genetic. I'm going to go through my treatment then push for genetic testing for our children. Seems to hit our family in our forties x
Posts.Title: Discovered a family history

Posts.Content: Yep good things defo come from Cancer. I had both my boobies removed and the good news is........ They've removed the cancer. Ive done the chemo fec and Tax and apart from turning bright red (looked a bit like a tomato) I pretty much sailed through it. Ive got 4 weeks of radiotherapy to go and then Im pretty much done. The great news is........................... A year after radiotherapy they will reconstruct my boobies with my belly fat so I get a boob job and a tummy tuck. This means that before I hit 48 years old I will look like a Barbie doll...... Ding Dong Ha Ha..... I am busy cutting out pictures of models for the surgeon to work with....... HURRAH
Posts.Title: Can good things come from having Cancer?

Posts.Content: With fec I had to take three steroids for 3 days after the chemo but I could take them all at once first thing in the morning then I was done on and still got a good nights sleep. On the 5th day I had to inject myself for 3 days to kick start my bone marrow. I hated the steroids. They have already given them to me to take for a couple of days before the first tax. I hope I can still take them all at once because sleep and water seem to be really controlling any side effects for me and more importantly keeping my blood count above 1.5 so can have my next chemo. Good luck with the fec you can ask me anything. Oh and it might be worth asking your bc nurse for one of their magic meds to deal with constipation. Not everyone gets it but I did and it was caused by the sickness tablets you have to take for 3 days after chemo along with the steroids. X
Posts.Title: Not looking forward to starting FEC on Thursday

Posts.Content: I am the opposite way to you. I've just finished my three fecs and I'm having three tax starting on 30th sept. I found the fec doable. I wasn't sick I took all my meds. With fec your urine will go bright red and I found drinking loads and loads of water and turning my urine back to normal as quickly as possible ie in the same day if you can made a huge difference to the side effects. I didn't do this with the first one and got mouth ulcers but with the second I drank loads and got none. I lost my hair in the same week as my first chemo however, most people lose theirs at about day 16 but mine is now growing back!!!! Very odd I know. I am really worried about the tax so any advice you can give me would be greatly appreciated x
Posts.Title: Not looking forward to starting FEC on Thursday

Posts.Content: We'll done ladies, so very positive. I've been bald for a few weeks now although amazingly I appear to have grown a thin layer of wispy hair, not enough to have a full head of hair. However, I do enjoy opening the bedroom window at night and feeling a cool breeze on my head. I've always had loads of hair so It's been quite liberating in a funny way. The good news is that the chemo is working otherwise our hair wouldn't fall out so a toast must be in order xxx
Posts.Title: hair starting to go :-(

Posts.Content: Ps jmp....... So glad your selfish ex showed his true colours and didn't waste any more of your time Hun. X
Posts.Title: tv advert

Posts.Content: We are allowed to take one person in but I don't because I usually see the same people every three weeks having their chemo. We all love a gossip last time we slagged off clooneys bride. Decided she was rather plump...... Ha ha just jealous but we had a laugh. I like catching up with them and my hubby would be worried silly if he saw them doing the chemo. He's much better outside the chemo ward. That being said we have the option here in kent it seems you are denied the option which isn't fair. If you want someone with you you should be allowed unless they are unwell. The advert isn't very good is it. Xxx
Posts.Title: tv advert

Posts.Content: My bc nurse gave me diflan when I got mouth ulcer, it worked a treat x
Posts.Title: numbness on chemo

Posts.Content: Congratulations, make me feel even more positive to read this post. X
Posts.Title: I did it!! 😜

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry to hear your news. My sister also has it in her bones and she is receiving palliative chemo but she is in her forties. It's quite debilitating all this chemo and at times I guess you need to weigh up quality of life versus the effects and side effects of chemo plus your age and no doubt your friend feels she has made the right choice. I think misty is right. It's time to enjoy the time you have lots of fun laughs great food wine and anything else that floats your boat. We are rinsing every last laugh out of my sister. She is a total social butterfly. Sending you loads of hugs xxx
Posts.Title: breast cancer spread to bones

Posts.Content: Hi all, I just wanted to tell you about a lovely lady I meet every three weeks when I have my chemo. She's has been through all the ops and chemo and she comes in for her herceptin injection. I just wanted to say, she looks absolutely fantastic she says her hair has grown back healthier than it ever was before and she feels great. I hope that gives you a bit of reassurance. X
Posts.Title: New to this!

Posts.Content: Hi wide awakers.... Needed a wee and now I can't get back to sleep. Bones are aching. V annoying.... I don't think you are being irrational either. The problem with bc is that it is all consuming. Tons of appointments, side effects, treatment. Even visibly we look different so it obvious that you feel that you are losing your safety blanket because your blanket is all the stuff above. So now we have to turn the next page of the chapter and find our next safety blanket, be it surgery, radiotherapy, hair growth!!!!!. Congratulations on getting so far. I'm right behind you 5th one on October 21st. I can't wait to get through this bit and have a bit of a break over Xmas and maybe a bit of hair!!!!!!! I'm looking forward to losing my inconvenient all time consuming safety blanket and replacing it with stuff I want to do xxx
Posts.Title: 5th Chemo done 1 more to go , should be happy .....but

Posts.Content: Hi murphy I've just had my second chemo and I have found this site to be a godsend for all sorts of queries. Just ask away someone somewhere has been there done it and got the t shirt. It's great to know you are not alone I have found it invaluable. As someone said to me when I first went onto the site "welcome to the club that no one wants to be a member of)!!!!!!! Lots of love Katie xxx
Posts.Title: New to this!

Posts.Content: Hi just a quick question. On fec my chemo took about an hour. How long does it take for tax? I start tax on 30th sept. I found the fec was ok I needed mordal sachets to combat constipation thanks to the sickness tablets taken for 3 days after chemo. Steroids were ok but I notice I'm going to get loads more steroids with tax. I already inject myself daily for blood clots and for 3 days after the 5th day of chemo and you get used to injecting yourself very quickly. It doesn't hurt. I'm a bit nervous about the tax x
Posts.Title: New member of Breast Cancer group

Posts.Content: Oh thanks for the advice. I've done the fec so any questions, don't hesitate to ask. I've heard the tax is harder than the fec so oddly you may find yourself feeling better. Just watch out for constipation it's caused by the anti sickness tablets and over the shelf laxatives won't be good enough. So ask you bc nurse for some goodies mordal sachets are great and if you happen to get a sore mouth,ulcers,tongue ask them for difflam it's great stuff. Xxx
Posts.Title: New member of Breast Cancer group

Posts.Content: I have a lump in my breast and an infected metastatic lymph node and I am on my 4th chemo. Right from the onset I have been told I am being cured. So just because it's in your lymph node does not mean the end is nigh. I just wanted to put your mind at rest xxx
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer has spread to nodes, panicking

Posts.Content: Hi willow I'm having the same treatment as Andrea. I can honestly say that I am much happier with just my treatment plan than I was, doing the continual hospital apps and waiting for results to come back. Take advantage of your time off work the chemo cycle is trying but in a different way. Chemo, side effects, tired, feel better then chemo again..... Every three weeks and even now after having chemo it still feels like it's happening to someone else. All the very best, Katie xxx
Posts.Title: Feel like someone pressed the pause button!

Posts.Content: Oh now I'm confused. My chemo nurse told me to avoid paracetamol and only use ibruprofen. That being said I am allergic to penicillin so could that be the reason why? So sorry if I've mislead anyone. X
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: I've been told not to use paracetamol but to use ibuprofen. Check with your chemo nurse. I would recommend nurofen express for the headaches they have worked for me. Good luck with the chemo. Take a mag/book/candy crush! X
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Oh now I'm confused. My chemo nurse told me to avoid paracetamol and only use ibruprofen. That being said I am allergic to penicillin so could that be the reason why? So sorry if I've mislead anyone. X
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: My hair fell out in large clumps so my husband cut it short all of the dark hair has gone and I now have white, blonde wispy hair like a newborns all over my head and at the moment it seems to be growing. There wouldn't be enough for a full head of hair but I've only had 2 chemos and it's keeping my head warm..... As for the rest of me.... Well, it couldn't all come out could it!!!!!... I have to shave my legs, my armpits are patchy and I've lost everything on my privates. The only saving grace so far is the beard I spent a fortune having laser hair removal on has finally gone so no doubt will be the first thing that grows back!!!!!!!! That would be Sod's law...... X
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Oh alright then. The doc who did my bone scan was rather dishy. Unfortunately I was wearing my old faithful loafers, took them off for the scan and realised my feet stunk!!!!!
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: Mines an all female team so no crush. How absolutely dare ditzy have a consultant who's a spit for George clooney......... Not jealous or anything!!!!
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: Fantastic news I'm so happy for u. Xxx
Posts.Title: Great News

Posts.Content: We'll done and congratulations to all us bald or balding ladies.... Great news the chemo is working. It's bleaching our bodies and the hair loss proves it. Let's all celebrate.... Look how tough we are wearing wigs, turban, hair scarfs, fringes. Nothing stops us from going out and getting on with our lives. It's a dreadful disease but just look at how well we are dealing with it. Yes.... Tears on the way but no one can argue that sheer determination and spirit plus a bloody good website to talk with friends who understand is getting us all through xxx ps by Christmas our hair will be growing back.... Let's have a race xxx
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Oh alright then. The doc who did my bone scan was rather dishy. Unfortunately I was wearing my old faithful loafers, took them off for the scan and realised my feet stunk!!!!!
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: Congratulations on getting through chemo. It's your body Hun you do what you need to do. I feel the same. I want both removed so Cancer can't come back. I think it's the feeling if looking over your shoulder all the time. It's so all consuming isn't it. I have a way to go yet 2 more chemos. I just want this all done and to get on with my life. I may not even bother with reconstruction because I don't want to waste any more time. Funny how we all feel about this stuff at the beginning all I was concerned about was losing my hair.... Couldn't give a stuff about my hair now!!!!! Lots of hugs xxx
Posts.Title: last chemo,

Posts.Content: I've just had the first tax. I had to take 8 steroids a day for three days......I'm like the old lady in the film something about Mary when she accidentally drinks drugs. Now I'm into the injections and my bones ache. I'm tired but can't sleep and when I do sleep I wake up for a wee........other than being knackered I seem to be fine.... Ha ha never mind four chemos out the way and only two to go. I scrapped through the bloods which tells me just how important rest is to keep your bloods up. Rest and water!!!!! Lots of love Katie x
Posts.Title: I'm knackered.......

Posts.Content: I can't understand it. I usually have a good week before I have my next chemo which is due on 30th sept. But I am absolutely knackered. My eyelashes have fallen out so my eyes constantly running. I feel drained. My skin is really dry. I've just had to lay in bed. I've got bloods tomorrow if I wake up in time..... I'm tired of being tired. X
Posts.Title: I'm knackered.......

Posts.Content: Hi I had chemo 3fec and 3 tax then I had a double mastectomy (one breast was elective). I'm about to have radiotherapy. I was stage three lump in right breast and in one lymph node. I watched the chemo shrink the lumps and at the end they were tiny. I am on for a complete cure. I'm not saying its a walk in the park but I am saying don't be afraid. It doesn't matter what treatment plan you have, they are tailored to suit you. The good news is that when I have my breast construction they will use the fat from my belly to build my new boobies so I'm getting great tits and a tummy tuck to boot..... Hurrah!!!!!! the chemo is different for all of us, we all have different side effects but I would say this. Drink drink drink loads and loads of water. If you are on fec your wee will be bright red.  Aim to drink so much water that you turn your wee back to its normal colour the same day. I found this really reduced the side effects. The fec only has to bleach you, you don't have to keep it so wash it out as fast as you can. Secondly I bought manuka honey, highest strength I could buy 15plus and I had a spoonful everyday. I found it prevented mouth ulcers (and boy did I get them after the first chemo). I also invested in plastic cutlery and a plastic beaker. Daft as it sounds when everything tasted of cardboard tea tasted great in a plastic cup... I have no idea why but it really worked. Finally this didn't work for me but it did my cousin. Use waterproof mascara it prevents your eyelashes falling out.... Don't clean it off just keep putting it on. As I say this did not work for me but if it works for someone it's worth a shot..... Incidentally my cousin is through the other side. She's had reconstruction on a double mastectomy and her new boobies look great. She even had nipples tattooed and you couldn't tell the difference. It is truly amazing what the medical profession can do these days. i wish you lots of love, all the best, you will find loads of helpful advice here, someone somewhere has been through it, also I found no one minds if you have a rant...... So moan away!!!!!!!! Finally invest in a good sense of humour.... Step back from your illness and see the world as it really is.... I found this helped me through the tough times. Xxx
Posts.Title: Which Treatment 1st??

Posts.Content: I love this post. Congratulations you are through the other side and with hair!!!!!! Albeit an odd colour..... Who cares hair is hair ..... I can't wait to get my hair and eyelashes back x
Posts.Title: First day without hairpiece!

Posts.Content: I was the same as sazza I had fec t in my arm not my hand i thought it would be really clinical. It's not I, like lots of other patients at the same time sat in a comfy armchair for an hour whilst the saline and drugs were administered. I played candy crush on my iPad. Read magazines and ate sweets. It didn't hurt. Good luck with your chemo xxx
Posts.Title: Starting chemo and terrified!

Posts.Content: I'm the same as you grade 3 her 2 positive but I also have one infected lymph node. I am having 6 chemos, month off, surgery, month off, radiotherapy, then ten yrs of tamoxifen. I have been told I am 100% curable. I didn't get a choice I was told I had to have the chemo. My lump was 8mm but I guess it was the infected lymph node that did it.... Hope this helps. If you have chemo I would just say it really is doable. Xxx
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Oh bless you, I do hope you are feeling better now. The cold cap feels colder because your hair has thinned and so naturally is closer and colder on your head. It has a 40% success rate. I didn't have it in the end because I didn't want to wait 3 hrs and I don't like being cold ha ha. That being said the lady next to me has a full head of hair even though she looks like she's going to fly a plane!!!!! Great news about the anti sickness lots of people gave recommended emend on this site. Get well soon xxx
Posts.Title: 2nd fec day 2

Posts.Content: Yes what is the clean 9 programme?
Posts.Title: Clean 9 Nutritional Cleansing Programme

Posts.Content: Ha ha love your post. I've got my first tax on 30th sept. I've got the steroids to fully charge myself and I also take manuka honey 15+ every day. Please let me know how you get on. I'm a bit nervous about all the steroids. There is another lady on here who is doing hers the other way around tax then fec and she seems to have coped really well. It's all doable I guess. Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Taxatere tomorrow! 😩

Posts.Content: Hi tefal, my oncologist told me I could expect to get lumps on my head as we'll due to losing hair and it getting trapped ...... Looking forward to more lumps.... Not x
Posts.Title: Lumps and dull aches - which was more important????

Posts.Content: Last week five lumps came up, three in the groin and two under the armpit. Jolly painful, however, the oncologist was not at all concerned, they are all to do with my hair falling out and are simply trapped hair follicles I just need to keep an eye and ensure they don't burst and get infected. As it turns out all five lumps have gone down. This morning I woke with a small jelly-ish lump near the crease of my elbow and a dull ache in the elbow creases and the backs of my knees. Mentioned it in passing to the bc nurse after my usual blood tests. This turned out to be far more serious. Five vials of blood later it turns out I am a slightly higher risk than usual for blood clots..... Just goes to show that what you think is unimportant ie a dull ache can be far more serious than the five more painful lumps!!!! Just thought I'd mention it in case anyone else has a dull ache they haven't raised with their bc nurse..... Anyway am now sitting in bed because after they drained me of all my blood I felt knackered. Good fun all this bloomin chemo isn't it!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Lumps and dull aches - which was more important????

Posts.Content: I am on FEC-T I am having my second chemo on Tuesday. Just a little message to hopefully reassure you. It wasn't clinical. I sat in a comfy armchair with lots of other people all at different stages with different cancers having chemo. Some we're laughing and joking, others kept themselves to themselves, reading, writing "knitting".....!!!! (Couldn't help it Emma - sorry ). Seriously, they put a drip in my arm (cannula) and fed the chemo through the drip and it didn't hurt. I played candy crush and read my book. You might want to check out the side effects. I had the shakes with steroids then mouth ulcers. some have sickness. But you can rest assured that we have all (between us) had any side effects that you might get so ask away. The best advice is to drink drink drink loads and loads of water. Your first wee will be bright red so drink as much as you can and flush the chemo out as quickly as possible turn it a lighter shade of pink or back to normal if you possibly can. The quicker you get it out the less side effects (my sister told me this, she is on chemo no 4). The chemo only needs to go in and bleach your insides, it doesn't need to stay. Take water with you and start drinking as soon as they put it in and carry on. All the best I'm having mine at 10am so I will be thinking about you Katie xxx
Posts.Title: treatment starts Tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi My sister got her Macmillan nurse to write a letter saying she couldn't work as having chemo. Also I'm sure if you rang your gp surgery they would do you a sick note and you could just pop along and collect it in the same way as people collect repeat prescriptions. X
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: Just sending you some hugs..... When I was waiting for my diagnosis my doctor gave me some mild sleeping pills. I found them jolly helpful xxx
Posts.Title: breast cancer newbie

Posts.Content: Your ex partner sounds about as useful as a chocolate teapot. Talk about kick someone when they are down. The good news is you are now in great company. We get it. Feel free to moan or tell us what's going on or even ask advice. You are not alone xxx
Posts.Title: alone

Posts.Content: Hi I've finished my third fec and start tax on 30th sept. I just wanted to say that although my hair fell out after the first week of chemo it is now growing back. You may be lucky x
Posts.Title: Hair Re-growth

Posts.Content: Hi if you are in absolute agony difflam will numb your mouth clear up your mouth ulcers clear up a sore tongue and gums. I also use an age 1 to 6 yrs electric superman toothbrush and let it dance around my mouth. Bicarbonate of soda is helpful if you have no diff lam. I'm so sorry you are having a rough time after only one chemo but sending you lots of hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Sore mouth,sore scalp, sorely in need of advice, please!

Posts.Content: Hello ladies I just wondered if anyone else has experienced this and if so how did they deal with it. I woke up this morning with pain in my groin and under one armpit. On closer inspection I seem to have three lumps, they feel like boils, jolly painful as well. however, they look as though they are not going to burst but go down again. I also seem to be sore in my privates but it isn't thrush. I would normally be due a period now. My temperature is normal I'm not in pain anywhere else just on the lumps and a bit sore down below. Any ideas?
Posts.Title: Any one else had this side effect

Posts.Content: That sounds bloody awful. I think I would feel traumatised after that. I do hope the rest of your treatment you are treated with a bit more dignity and respect. It's bad enough waiting for results without people adding more grief to it. I do not think you are over reacting and I certainly don't think it is acceptable. I had loads of tests and biopsies etc and I was never treated like that. Everything was done on a personal one to one level. I felt safe and we'll looked after. Fingers crossed you don't have to go there again x
Posts.Title: Awaiting results of surgery

Posts.Content: So glad I found this discussion. I've had 3 fec 3 tax, double masectomy, radiotherapy and now I'm on anastrozole.  I also have to have a monthly goserlen injection because I'm post menopausal but can't take tamoxifen due to high risk of DVT. I'm due to have my ovaries out in December. I'm absolutely knackered...... I wake up like an old woman (I'm 47). I'm now about three stone overweight. I walk the dog everyday and work from home but I am aware that I cannot work as well as I did before. I too believe tax was the beginning of what I can only describe as an immense fatigue and loss of concentration. i can sleep for England and wake up knackered, sometimes I can't remember what I did the day before.....and I finished tax last November...... I was told it can take up to two years to recover from tax, when does it ever end????? X
Posts.Title: Quality of life 7 weeks in??

Posts.Content: You will find loads if help and advice here and feel free to have a grumble, we don't mind.... Fire away.... You seem to have a great positive attitude to it all, that will really help you on your journey lots of love Katie xxx
Posts.Title: 28years old with breast cancer!!!

Posts.Content: Oh wow I'm sitting here can't get to sleep. And your post has really cheered me up. Congratulations you deserve it. I'm going to google up some holidays now in preparation for next year.... Xxx
Posts.Title: There is hope!

Posts.Content: Hurrah eyelashes........ I can't wait for some hair..... I've got two hairs on my toes so far.....
Posts.Title: An exciting day!

Posts.Content: Oh bless my heart goes out to you. I haven't had surgery yet I'm still doing the chemo but I totally get the studying. I work from home but am also studying for a degree in history. Just started the second year when I got diagnosed so just doing the one module. It means I have an extra year of study. Not a problem in the grand scheme of things. I do it for enjoyment not for a career. I'm already qualified for my job but it is annoying that you can't do as much as you would like isn't it. I have however found a positive.... I read far more history books than I ever did before ie hour of chemo in bed etc etc so I expect to get a bloody good mark!!!!!! All the best xxx
Posts.Title: Here I go again!

Posts.Content: Hello everyone My name is Katie and I was advised by dreamthief to come to this site. I start my chemo on Tuesday and I am fortunate to have a potentially positive outcome. I also have a sister who was diagnosed 6 weeks before me who's outcome is not so positive. That being said she is the social butterfly...... currently camping with her mates as we speak...........(She is bless her NUTS)!!!!!! I wondered if any of you have some tips for me that I might experiment/pass on.   For example my sister tells me I should drink tons and tons of water after chemo to help prevent the mouth ulcers. My cousin (who is now in remission) told her to use waterproof mascara to prevent your eyelashes from falling out. TREAT ME AS A GUINEA PIG!!!!!!!!! I am a newby, lets test the water and see what happens..... Until Monday (My first Chemo is Tuesday). Please dump all of your advise under this discussion...... I have bought the waterproof mascara and I have loaded the fridge with bottled water......... Did anyone give you advice that you didn't take and wished you did????? I will let you know how I got on. Best of health everyone Katie XXX
Posts.Title: I am a Newby......and potential guinea pig!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone. Just need to get the thermometer, ginger biscuits and pineapple. I won't ask my sister to get them.... She won't remember!!!!!!!! Ha ha
Posts.Title: I am a Newby......and potential guinea pig!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks flip flop for the honey tip. My sister suffers really badly with mouth ulcers/thrush she,s tried the cancer goody bag which helps but she was really cheesed off as soon as she got rid of one lot it came back again........(she moaned at me the other day because she can't taste butter one of her favourite foods). she's on her fourth chemo so I will buy us both some and let you all know how we both got on x
Posts.Title: I am a Newby......and potential guinea pig!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Tea in a plastic beaker and three packets of biskwits........ I still can't see the problem either susie... Anyway when Monika and lemon purple girl get back to us with the results of the yoga, I will take that up and lose my biskwit belly!!!!!!!! After my fec t I've got three docetaxel so I'm really interested to hear about side effects and advice too. Forewarned is forearmed even if we are only armed with a spoonful of manuka honey, a plastic beaker, waterproof mascara, nail polish and Ginger biskwits. Anyway, wish me luck I'm off to collect my wig today. I got one ordered to look as close to my normal hair as possible so as not to scare my five year old. (Although I did look pretty damn good in the brown long haired wig) ha ha never mind blonde mass of curls all over the place - here I come!!!!!!!!! Lots of love Katie Xxx
Posts.Title: I am a Newby......and potential guinea pig!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. Sorry not to reply sooner but we moved house........ I know...... Mad isn't it. I didn't plan on getting breast cancer.... Talk about bad timing.... Anyway. I had the FEC T on 29th July and I took your advice and drank tons and tons of water, so much water that by the same evening my bright red wee was a lovely shade of pink...... If you do anything at all drink drink drink and flush that dreadful stuff out asap. It worked for me. The biggest problem I had was the three days of steroids following the chemo. I had to take three steroids plus two sickness tablets for three days afterwards. Talk about getting the shakes....... You name it I dropped it.... Cups plates..... I have now invested in a delightful range of plastic crockery!!!!!! I carried on shaking after the three days but I am now feeling ok. I have stuck to water although I'd love a glass of wine.... Ha ha. Devoured all fruit n veg, painted my toe and finger nails so they don't fall off and slathered my eyelashes in waterproof mascara. Not sure if that's a good idea though I got dry eye in one eye..... On the first night after chemo I sat in bed and ate a large packet of ginger biscuits (because I'm allowed - very nice too, although I admit I wasn't really feeling sick I just liked eating them). After the fifth day I had to have an injection for three days to encourage my bone marrow to produce more blood cells. I got the nurse to teach me how to do this myself. Quick painless stab in my biscuit filled belly and I'm done......the best bit is I'm now not waiting around for the nurse to turn up. So albeit a bit of control of my life with no interruptions. My husband has gone bonkers... Am I alright? do I need to go to bed?...... Nope I'm fine have now moved from ginger biscuits to foxes ginger crunches...(well...they are ginger). In short I'm doing ok. My hair is getting brittle, probably getting ready to fall out but I consider that a small price (although highly inconvenient) to pay if it gets rid of the cancer. So to all my fellow newbies et al. Touch wood (just touched head) I've been ok and I hope you all get the same or better. Ps keep the tips coming I promise to test them all Lots of love Katie Xxx
Posts.Title: I am a Newby......and potential guinea pig!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: I think we should all test the ideas/tips we are given and produce a little guide for dream thief to send to all newbies. For example I have accidentally tested kazzy k,s advice to use plastic crockery (I kept breaking things with the steroids) but guess what. It really does work. It gets rid of the metallic taste. I had a lovely cup of tea in a plastic beaker..... Metallic taste comes back afterwards but who cares.... Tea is tea and us Brits love tea!!!!!! Lots of love Katie X
